_comment: Material-specific health and toxicity considerations for specifiers and occupants.

steel-frame.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

steel-columns-beams.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

rammed-earth-structure.note: Natural material with excellent indoor air quality. Stabilisers (cement/lime) are inert once cured.

timber-flooring.note: Natural material. Check finish and adhesive for VOC emissions—specify E1 or better for engineered products.

glass-door.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Sealants and gaskets should be low-VOC.

acoustic-ceiling-baffles.note: Check core material composition. Mineral fibre can release particles during installation—ensure proper sealing.

concrete-frame.note: Inert once cured. Silica dust during construction requires PPE. Admixtures should be verified for low toxicity.

rc-columns-beams.note: Inert once cured. Silica dust during construction requires PPE. Admixtures should be verified for low toxicity.

glulam-structure.note: Natural material with good indoor air quality. Verify adhesive emissions class (E1 or better) for enclosed spaces.

green-oak-structure.note: Natural untreated material with excellent indoor air quality. No adhesives or chemical treatments.

glulam-columns-beams.note: Natural material with good indoor air quality. Verify adhesive emissions class (E1 or better) for enclosed spaces.

clt-structure.note: Natural material with good indoor air quality. Verify adhesive emissions class (E1 or better) for enclosed spaces.

brick-veneer.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Excellent for indoor air quality.

polished-concrete.note: Inert once cured. Sealers and densifiers should be verified for low VOC content.

hybrid-structure.note: Check adhesives and connections for emissions. Timber elements should meet E1 formaldehyde class.

space-frame-structure.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings should be verified for low VOC content.

nlt-structure.note: Natural material. Verify adhesive and fastener coatings for emissions if exposed internally.

ggbs-concrete.note: Inert once cured. GGBS is a by-product with no additional health concerns vs standard concrete.

lino-floor.note: Natural material (linseed oil, cork, wood flour) with low emissions. May have temporary odour during installation.

recycled-terrazzo.note: Inert once cured. Resin-bound versions may have higher emissions than cement-bound—verify with EPD.

rubber-floor.note: New rubber flooring can off-gas VOCs. Specify products meeting indoor air quality standards. Allow ventilation period post-installation.

grey-carpet.note: Can emit VOCs from fibres, backing, and adhesives. Specify CRI Green Label Plus or equivalent. Consider wool alternatives.

bamboo-parquet.note: Natural material. Verify adhesive emissions class (E1 or better). Low-VOC finish essential for good indoor air quality.

cork-plank-floor.note: Natural material with excellent indoor air quality. Verify binder and finish are low-VOC.

reclaimed-timber-floor.note: Test for lead paint or historic treatments on reclaimed material. Once verified clean, excellent indoor air quality.

stone-paver.note: Inert material. Some granites may emit low levels of radon—verify with supplier if used in enclosed spaces.

vinyl-planks.note: PVC flooring can contain phthalates and emit VOCs. Specify phthalate-free products meeting FloorScore or equivalent.

resin-flooring.note: High VOC emissions during application—requires ventilation. Once cured, emissions reduce significantly. Specify low-VOC systems.

microcement-floor.note: Inert once cured. Sealers should be verified for low VOC content.

ceramic-tiles.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Excellent for indoor air quality. Grout should be low-VOC.

epoxy-flooring.note: High VOC emissions during application. Once fully cured (7+ days), emissions reduce. Specify water-based or low-VOC epoxies where possible.

travertine-tiles.note: Inert natural material with no off-gassing. Excellent for indoor air quality.

marble-floor.note: Inert natural material with no off-gassing. Excellent for indoor air quality.

engineered-oak-floor.note: Natural surface with plywood core. Verify formaldehyde emissions class (E1 or better). Low-VOC finish essential.

linoleum-tiles.note: Natural material with low emissions. May have temporary linseed oil odour during installation.

aluminum-frame.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Powder coating is preferable to solvent-based finishes.

timber-frame.note: Natural material. Verify preservative treatments are non-toxic (avoid CCA). Untreated timber has excellent indoor air quality.

recycled-aluminum-frame.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Recycling process does not affect health properties.

steel-window-frame.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Galvanising and powder coating are preferable to solvent-based paints.

composite-window-frame.note: Check composite material composition. Some may contain formaldehyde-based resins. Verify emissions data.

upvc-window-frame.note: Historic uPVC contained lead stabilisers—verify lead-free formulation. Modern uPVC has low emissions once installed.

curtain-wall-system.note: Aluminium and glass are inert. Sealants and gaskets should be verified for low VOC content.

frameless-glazing.note: Glass is inert. Structural silicone should be low-VOC and verified for indoor air quality.

clay-plaster.note: Excellent for indoor air quality. Natural humidity buffering. No synthetic additives or emissions.

gypsum-wall.note: Inert once cured. Paper facing may attract mould if wet—ensure proper moisture management.

plasterboard-wall.note: Inert once cured. Paper facing may attract mould if wet—ensure proper moisture management.

plywood-panels-wall.note: Verify formaldehyde emissions class (E1 or better). Low-VOC finish essential for good indoor air quality.

acoustic-panels-wall.note: Check core material and fabric for emissions. Specify products meeting indoor air quality standards.

glass-partitions.note: Glass is inert with no off-gassing. Frame sealants should be low-VOC.

brick-internal.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Excellent for indoor air quality.

concrete-block-wall.note: Inert once cured. Excellent for indoor air quality when left exposed or painted with low-VOC paint.

mineral-microcement.note: Inert once cured. Sealers should be verified for low VOC content.

standard-wall-paint.note: Conventional paints emit VOCs. Specify low-VOC or zero-VOC formulations. Allow adequate ventilation during drying.

custom-wall-paint.note: Conventional paints emit VOCs. Specify low-VOC or zero-VOC formulations. Allow adequate ventilation during drying.

standard-ceiling-paint.note: Conventional paints emit VOCs. Specify low-VOC or zero-VOC formulations. Allow adequate ventilation during drying.

custom-ceiling-paint.note: Conventional paints emit VOCs. Specify low-VOC or zero-VOC formulations. Allow adequate ventilation during drying.

perforated-metal-ceiling.note: Inert material. Acoustic backing should be verified for fibre release and emissions.

timber-slat-ceiling.note: Natural material. Verify fire treatment is non-toxic and finish is low-VOC.

gypsum-ceiling.note: Inert once cured. Excellent for indoor air quality.

open-grid-ceiling.note: Inert metal material with no off-gassing. Powder coating is preferable.

stretch-fabric-ceiling.note: PVC-based systems may contain phthalates and emit VOCs. Specify phthalate-free products or polyester alternatives.

coffered-ceiling.note: Depends on material—timber/MDF may emit formaldehyde. GRG is inert. Verify emissions class.

plasterboard-ceiling.note: Inert once cured. Excellent for indoor air quality.

exposed-clt-ceiling.note: Natural material with good indoor air quality. Verify adhesive emissions class (E1 or better).

metal-mesh-ceiling.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Powder coating is preferable to solvent-based finishes.

acoustic-tiles-ceiling.note: Mineral fibre tiles may release particles. Specify products meeting indoor air quality standards. Sealed surfaces reduce fibre release.

exposed-concrete-soffit.note: Inert once cured. Excellent for indoor air quality. Sealers should be low-VOC.

timber-slat-soffit.note: Verify preservative treatment for external soffits is non-toxic. Internal soffits should have low-VOC finish.

perforated-metal-soffit.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Powder coating is preferable.

timber-linings.note: Natural material. Verify fire treatment is non-toxic and any board substrate meets E1 emissions class.

bio-fibre-panels.note: Natural fibres are healthy. Verify binder is non-toxic and formaldehyde-free.

timber-wall-panels.note: Natural material. Verify adhesive and substrate emissions class (E1 or better). Low-VOC finish essential.

porcelain-tiles.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Excellent for indoor air quality.

textured-wallpaper.note: Paper-based wallpapers are generally low-emission. Vinyl wallpapers may emit VOCs. Specify low-VOC paste.

fabric-acoustic-panels.note: Check fabric and core for flame retardant treatments and emissions. Specify products meeting indoor air quality standards.

oak-timber-slats.note: Natural material with excellent indoor air quality. Verify fire treatment is non-toxic if applied.

cork-panels.note: Natural material with excellent indoor air quality. Verify any finish is low-VOC.

reclaimed-boarding.note: Test for lead paint or historic treatments. Once verified clean, excellent indoor air quality.

mycelium-tiles.note: Natural bio-based material with no synthetic additives. Excellent for indoor air quality.

wool-felt-panels.note: Natural material. Verify moth treatment is non-toxic (avoid permethrin). Excellent acoustic and air quality properties.

bamboo-slat-wall.note: Natural material. Verify adhesive emissions class (E1 or better). Low-VOC finish essential.

plywood-panels-finish.note: Verify formaldehyde emissions class (E1 or better). Low-VOC lacquer or oil finish essential.

marble-panels.note: Inert natural material with no off-gassing. Excellent for indoor air quality.

leather-panels.note: Chrome-tanned leather may contain chromium VI. Specify vegetable-tanned or chrome-free alternatives. Check fire retardant treatments.

metal-mesh-panels.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Powder coating is preferable.

glass-panels-finish.note: Glass is inert. Back-painting should use low-VOC paints.

acoustic-plaster.note: Mineral-based with low emissions once cured. Verify composition with manufacturer.

lime-plaster.note: Natural material with excellent indoor air quality. Humidity buffering and naturally antifungal.

tadelakt-plaster.note: Natural lime-based material with excellent indoor air quality. Soap treatment is non-toxic.

secondary-steelwork.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings should be verified for low VOC content.

brick-loadbearing.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Excellent for indoor air quality.

hempcrete-structural.note: Natural material with excellent indoor air quality. Humidity buffering and breathable. Lime binder is non-toxic.

steel-concrete-composite.note: Both materials are inert once cured. Excellent for indoor air quality.

precast-concrete.note: Inert once cured. Factory production typically results in consistent quality and low emissions.

mass-timber-columns.note: Natural material with good indoor air quality. Verify adhesive emissions class (E1 or better).

steel-trusses.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings should be verified for low VOC content.

prestressed-concrete.note: Inert once cured. Excellent for indoor air quality.

permeable-paving.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. External use minimises any indoor air quality impact.

joinery-built-in.note: Board materials may emit formaldehyde. Verify E1 class or better. Specify low-VOC finishes and adhesives.

brass-fixtures.note: Some brass alloys contain lead. Specify lead-free brass for any water contact applications.

standing-seam-roof.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

green-roof.note: Natural planting improves air quality. Ensure growing medium is contaminant-free.

cool-roof.note: External membrane with minimal indoor air quality impact. Verify any coatings are low-VOC.

pv-roof.note: External installation with no indoor air quality impact. Panels are sealed units.

blue-roof.note: External system with no indoor air quality impact. Liner materials should be food-safe if connected to harvesting.

clay-tiles-roof.note: Inert natural material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

slate-tiles-roof.note: Inert natural material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

metal-tiles-roof.note: Inert material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

epdm-membrane.note: Synthetic rubber with low emissions once installed. External use minimises any impact.

tpo-membrane.note: Thermoplastic with low emissions. External use minimises any indoor air quality impact.

built-up-roofing.note: Bitumen can emit VOCs and PAHs during application. External use minimises occupant exposure. Avoid hot-applied systems where possible.

polycarbonate-roof.note: Low emissions once installed. UV stabilisers are encapsulated within material.

wood-fiber-insulation.note: Natural material with excellent indoor air quality. Verify binder is non-toxic. Humidity buffering properties.

hemp-insulation.note: Natural material with excellent indoor air quality. Verify fire retardant (typically borate) is non-toxic.

sheep-wool-insulation.note: Natural material with excellent indoor air quality. Verify moth treatment is non-toxic. Excellent humidity buffering.

cellulose-insulation.note: Recycled paper with low emissions. Fire retardants (typically borate) are low-toxicity. Good for indoor air quality.

mineral-wool.note: Fibres can cause irritation during installation—use PPE. Verify formaldehyde-free binder. Once installed and covered, low emissions.

pir-insulation.note: Isocyanates used in manufacture. Once cured, low emissions. Toxic fumes if burned—ensure adequate fire protection.

aerogel-insulation.note: Silica-based with low emissions. Fine dust during cutting—use PPE. Once installed, excellent for indoor air quality.

timber-door.note: Natural material. Verify core construction meets E1 emissions class. Low-VOC finish essential.

steel-door.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Verify any foam core insulation emissions.

aluminum-door.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Powder coating is preferable.

composite-door.note: Check composite material composition. Foam cores and resins may emit. Verify emissions data.

fire-rated-door.note: Fire-resistant cores may contain formaldehyde. Intumescent seals are inert until activated. Verify emissions data.

glass-balustrade.note: Glass is inert with no off-gassing. Excellent for indoor air quality.

steel-railing.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Powder coating is preferable.

timber-railing.note: Natural material. Verify preservative treatment is non-toxic for internal use. Low-VOC finish essential.

cable-railing.note: Stainless steel is inert with no off-gassing. Excellent for indoor air quality.

mesh-railing.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Powder coating is preferable.

gravel-paving.note: Natural inert material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

resin-bound-gravel.note: Resin may emit VOCs during application. Once cured, low emissions. External use minimises impact.

concrete-paving.note: Inert material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

block-paving.note: Inert material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

grass-reinforcement.note: Plastic grid with natural grass. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

decking-external.note: Verify preservative treatment is non-toxic (avoid CCA). External use minimises exposure.

zinc-cladding.note: Inert material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

copper-cladding.note: Inert material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

aluminium-cladding.note: Inert material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

weathering-steel-cladding.note: Inert material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

timber-rainscreen.note: Verify preservative treatment is non-toxic. External use minimises exposure.

stone-facade.note: Inert natural material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

insulated-render-system.note: Render may contain biocides. EPS/PIR boards have low emissions once installed. External use minimises impact.

living-green-wall.note: Plants improve air quality. Verify irrigation system and growing medium are contaminant-free.

native-planting.note: Natural planting improves air quality. No health concerns.

wildflower-meadow.note: Natural planting improves air quality. No health concerns.

rain-garden.note: Natural planting improves air quality. No health concerns.

aluminium-standing-seam-roof.note: Inert material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

copper-standing-seam-roof.note: Inert material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

stainless-standing-seam-roof.note: Inert material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

lead-standing-seam-roof.note: Lead is toxic during fabrication. Use safe handling and keep surfaces sealed.

lead-cladding.note: Lead is toxic during fabrication. Use safe handling and keep surfaces sealed.

stainless-cladding.note: Inert material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

stone-rainscreen.note: Inert natural material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

slate-cladding.note: Inert natural material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

terracotta-panels.note: Inert natural material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

brick-slip-rainscreen.note: Inert natural material. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

glass-facade.note: Glass is inert. Sealants should be low-VOC.

etfe-tensile-facade.note: ETFE is inert once installed. External use means no indoor air quality impact.

insulated-metal-panels.note: Foam cores can include isocyanates. Low emissions once installed. Ensure fire protection.

metal-composite-panels.note: Composite panels can include polymer cores and fire treatments. Specify low-emission products.

cork-rainscreen.note: Verify preservative treatment is non-toxic. External use minimises exposure.

charred-timber-cladding.note: Verify preservative treatment is non-toxic. External use minimises exposure.

wood-fibre-lime-render.note: Natural lime-based render with low emissions once cured.

fibre-cement-panels.note: Inert once installed. Dust and fibres during cutting require PPE.

gfrc-grc-panels.note: Inert once installed. Dust and fibres during cutting require PPE.

balcony-support-beams.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

cross-bracing-steel.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

curtain-wall-mullions-transoms.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

edge-beams.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

facade-support-rails.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

k-x-bracing-secondary.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

lightweight-space-frame-infill.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

masonry-shelf-angles.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

rainscreen-carrier-systems.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

secondary-cantilever-arms.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

secondary-facade-brackets.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

secondary-lintels.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

secondary-steel-infill-beams.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

secondary-trusses.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

spandrel-beams.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

stair-landings-trimmers.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

steel-canopy-frames.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

steel-purlins.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

steel-stair-stringers.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

tension-rods-tie-members.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

precast-concrete-floor-planks.note: Inert once cured. Dust during cutting requires PPE.

precast-concrete-panels.note: Inert once cured. Dust during cutting requires PPE.

ring-beams.note: Inert once cured. Dust during cutting requires PPE.

composite-metal-deck-slabs.note: Inert once cured. Dust during cutting requires PPE.

diaphragm-bracing-elements.note: Composite materials may include resins or cores that emit VOCs. Verify emissions data.

secondary-shear-panels.note: Composite wood products may contain formaldehyde-based resins. Specify low-emission products.

raised-access-floor-systems.note: Panel cores and adhesives may emit VOCs. Specify low-emission products and sealed edges.

clt-floor-panels.note: Natural material. Engineered products may use adhesives—verify low emissions and low-VOC finishes.

clt-loadbearing-walls.note: Natural material. Engineered products may use adhesives—verify low emissions and low-VOC finishes.

clt-roof-panels.note: Natural material. Engineered products may use adhesives—verify low emissions and low-VOC finishes.

glulam-roof-beams.note: Natural material. Engineered products may use adhesives—verify low emissions and low-VOC finishes.

timber-joists-floor-cassettes.note: Natural material. Engineered products may use adhesives—verify low emissions and low-VOC finishes.

timber-stair-carriages.note: Natural material. Engineered products may use adhesives—verify low emissions and low-VOC finishes.

timber-wind-bracing.note: Natural material with low emissions. Verify finishes are low-VOC.

timber-pergola-structures.note: Verify preservative treatment is non-toxic. External use minimises exposure.

timber-rafters-purlins.note: Verify preservative treatment is non-toxic. External use minimises exposure.

cantilevered-stair-treads.note: Natural material. Engineered products may use adhesives—verify low emissions and low-VOC finishes.

masonry-loadbearing.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Mortars and sealants should be low-VOC.

cork-insulation.note: Natural material with excellent indoor air quality. Verify any binder or treatment is non-toxic.

hemp-lime-wall.note: Natural material with excellent indoor air quality. Verify any binder or treatment is non-toxic.

metal-chair.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Verify coatings are low-VOC.

modular-shelving.note: Inert material with no off-gassing. Verify coatings are low-VOC.

oak-dining-table.note: Natural material with low emissions. Verify finishes are low-VOC.

plywood-furniture.note: Natural material. Engineered products may use adhesives—verify low emissions and low-VOC finishes.

reclaimed-timber-furniture.note: Reclaimed timber is low-emission. Verify any treatments are non-toxic.

upholstered-seating.note: Foam and fabrics can emit VOCs or have flame retardant treatments. Specify low-emission products.

living-wall-external.note: Natural planting improves air quality. No health concerns.

ornamental-planting.note: Natural planting improves air quality. No health concerns.

tree-planting.note: Natural planting improves air quality. No health concerns.
